name: Alex Martinez
title: Full-Stack Engineer building AI systems, Developer Tools, and Data Platforms
tagline: I build scalable systems and AI-driven products that turn complex data into simple, meaningful tools for developers and teams.

hero.name: Alex Martinez
hero.title: Full-Stack Engineer building AI systems, Developer Tools, and Data Platforms
hero.tagline: I build scalable systems and AI-driven products that turn complex data into simple, meaningful tools for developers and teams.

about.title: About Me
bio: I'm a full-stack engineer who enjoys building intelligent systems that combine data, AI, and modern web technologies.
My work focuses on analytics platforms and AI-powered products, from developer insight tools like OpenQ DRM and GoGitGuru to conversational and on-device AI systems such as Saya and Geist AI.
I like designing scalable backend architectures, building frontend dashboards, and delivering reliable solutions that make an impact.

description: Built and maintained OpenQ DRM and GoGitGuru, powering the Ethereum Ecosystem Report with large-scale GitHub data processing.
Improved data pipelines and Kafka topic design, enabling concurrent processing of thousands of repositories and reducing ingestion latency.
Developed evaluation and synchronization systems across Go and TypeScript services to keep GitHub data consistent between MongoDB and PostgreSQL.
Worked on Saya, an AI platform that converts natural language queries into SQL for GitHub developer discovery, and Geist AI, an on-device multi-agent chat system focused on privacy and speed.
Automated Helm-based deployments and CI/CD workflows with GitHub Actions to ensure reliable multi-environment releases on GKE.
Contributed to Stackless, a data platform connecting Fivetran, Snowflake, and GoodData for automated analytics pipelines.
Developed onboarding flows and backend integrations that simplified client setup and reduced manual configuration time.
Built React-based dashboards with Strapi CMS and Node services, integrating and embedding GoodData BI dashboards for advanced data visualization.
Improved page performance and responsiveness by implementing chunked pagination and optimizing data fetching.
Occasionally helped startups with maintenance work and small integrations, focusing on frontend development, API connections, and cloud setup for existing projects.
Improved robot validation tools written in Python, increasing testing accuracy and reliability.
Reduced ISO image generation time by 20% by optimizing build pipelines with Bash and Docker.
Migrated the codebase to Python 3 and integrated CI/CD workflows using GitHub and Jenkins for faster and more consistent delivery.

contact.title: Get In Touch
contact.subtitle: Open to collaborations, freelance work, or a quick chat about tech and ideas.
contact.heading: Let's Connect
contact.description: If you're looking for a full-stack engineer who works across AI, data, and cloud systems, or just want to share something interesting, feel free to reach out. I usually reply within a day.

message.label: Message

submit.success: Thanks for reaching out. I’ll get back to you soon.
submit.error: Something went wrong. Please try again or email me directly.

card.title: Saya
card.shortDescription: AI-powered GitHub developer discovery platform that understands natural language to find top engineers through real data.

modal.title: Saya
modal.subtitle: AI-powered developer discovery platform
modal.purpose: Saya helps recruiters and companies find developers through natural language queries that analyze real GitHub activity instead of resumes.
modal.overview: Built as a customer-facing MVP, Saya combines an AI chat interface with live data from GitHub to identify relevant developers. It converts user queries into optimized SQL statements using Google Gemini 2.5 Flash, running them against OpenQ’s GitGuru database. The app features real-time WebSocket communication, credit-based access control, Clerk authentication, and interactive visualizations for query results.

items: Translates natural language into SQL queries with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash
Implements structured function calling for precise query generation
Includes schema-aware prompts for accurate and efficient query building
Express 5.1 server with TypeScript and WebSocket integration
JWT-secured real-time connections with streaming AI responses
Credit-based authorization using PermissionsClient pattern
Webhook support and Clerk authentication integration
React 19.1 + Vite 7.0 frontend in TypeScript
Chat-like WebSocket interface with real-time AI streaming
Interactive tables for developer data and error visualizations
Built with Clerk, Radix UI, and TailwindCSS 4.1
Multi-stage Docker builds for small, secure images
Monorepo setup managed with pnpm 10 and Turbo
Layered modular architecture for clear separation of concerns

technicalHighlights: Eliminated database timeout issues by refactoring query logic with performance rules
Implemented secure WebSocket layer with credit tracking and real-time AI streaming
Built modular AI tool architecture for flexible function calling and expansion
Used Docker multi-stage builds and non-root containers for better security

metrics.performance: Reduced database timeouts to zero by optimizing query strategies
metrics.scalability: Handles concurrent user queries with JWT-secured real-time sessions

card.title: Geist AI
card.shortDescription: Local-first AI chat app with multi-agent system, on-device inference, and private memory.

modal.title: Geist AI
modal.subtitle: On-device AI Chat with Multi-Agent System
modal.purpose: Geist AI is a mobile chat app that runs locally and focuses on privacy, speed, and context. It uses a multi-agent setup where each agent handles a specific task and can interact with others dynamically. The system combines local inference, persistent memory, and voice input to create fast and context-aware conversations without relying on external APIs.
modal.overview: The app runs fully on-device using llama.cpp with GPU acceleration, SQLite for semantic memory, and Whisper for voice transcription. A FastAPI backend supports optional remote inference, embeddings, and analytics. The frontend is built with React Native and Expo for smooth cross-platform performance and local-first behavior.

items: Multi-agent setup with specialized reasoning, creative, and negotiation agents
Function and tool calling with recursive task execution
Local llama.cpp inference optimized for GPU acceleration
Semantic memory retrieval using SQLite and cosine similarity
FastAPI microservices for inference, embeddings, memory, and Whisper STT
Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time streaming responses
GPU acceleration with Metal and NVIDIA CUDA
PostgreSQL for session tracking and metrics
React Native + Expo with TypeScript strict mode
Voice input and output via Whisper integration
SQLite-based on-device memory and offline chat storage
Custom TokenBatcher for smooth 60fps chat rendering
Kubernetes deployment with Helm charts for multiple services
GPU scheduling with NVIDIA GPU Operator
MetalLB for load balancing and Ingress-Nginx for routing
Automated TLS certificates using cert-manager and Let’s Encrypt

technicalHighlights: Reduced local inference latency from 20s to 1–2s using Metal-optimized llama.cpp builds
Achieved sub-5s first-token latency and >10 tokens/sec throughput
Implemented on-device semantic memory for context recall
Added LLM-based price negotiation flow using RevenueCat SDK
Deployed 8+ GPU-aware microservices with Kubernetes orchestration

metrics.performance: Sub-5s first-token latency and >10 tokens/sec throughput
metrics.optimization: Reduced local inference latency from 20s to 1–2s using GPU-accelerated builds
metrics.rendering: Maintained 60fps rendering via TokenBatcher with 16ms flush intervals

card.title: OpenQ DRM
card.shortDescription: Enterprise analytics platform for analyzing GitHub repositories, users, and dependencies with event-driven microservices.

modal.title: OpenQ DRM
modal.subtitle: Developer Relationship Management Platform
modal.purpose: OpenQ DRM is an enterprise analytics platform built to analyze GitHub repositories, contributors, and dependencies at scale. It helps teams evaluate developer ecosystems, discover key contributors, and track open-source adoption across organizations and projects.
modal.overview: The platform runs on an event-driven architecture using Kafka, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL. It processes large-scale GitHub data through distributed microservices for evaluation, synchronization, and insight generation. The system is fully containerized, deployed on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) with Helm, and integrates Next.js 15 and tRPC for a type-safe frontend and API layer.

items: Event-driven architecture using Kafka and MongoDB change streams for real-time processing
Distributed Saga pattern to manage multi-step workflows with retry and compensation logic
Batch evaluation system with adaptive concurrency for faster throughput
Cursor-based pagination and optimized aggregation pipelines for scalable queries
Evaluation engine with dedicated runners for repositories, users, and dependencies
Integration with Go-based GitGuru service for commit and dependency analysis
Automated insights including contributor overlaps and adoption metrics
Cursor-based pagination with O(1) lookup for large datasets
Next.js 15 app with React 19 and tRPC for fully type-safe APIs
Real-time progress tracking for evaluations and background jobs
Dashboards with charts, maps, and filtering for contributor and repository analytics
Modern UI built with Radix UI, Tailwind CSS, and Tiptap editor
12+ microservices deployed on GKE Autopilot with Helm charts
Kafka scaling with 25 concurrent consumers per topic
Kubernetes CronJobs for continuous sync of repositories and users
Automated CI/CD pipelines via CircleCI and NGINX Ingress routing with TLS termination

technicalHighlights: Adopted event-driven architecture with Kafka and MongoDB change streams for real-time evaluations
Implemented distributed Saga pattern with retry and compensation to maintain workflow consistency
Reduced evaluation time by ~40% using adaptive batching and intelligent concurrency
Deployed multi-environment infrastructure (dev/staging/prod) on GKE Autopilot with Helm
Integrated Stripe for billing and NextAuth for OAuth-based authentication

metrics.scalability: Runs 12+ microservices with distributed Kafka topics and 25 concurrent consumers per topic
metrics.reliability: Event-driven workflows ensure near real-time data updates via MongoDB change streams
metrics.performance: Batch evaluation improved throughput and reduced runtime by approximately 40%

card.title: GitHub Scraper
card.shortDescription: Full-stack app that analyzes GitHub repositories and generates contributor leaderboards through asynchronous processing.

modal.title: GitHub Scraper
modal.subtitle: Repository Analysis and Leaderboard Generator
modal.purpose: GitHub Scraper analyzes commit histories from repositories to generate contributor leaderboards. It helps understand collaboration activity and identify top contributors across public and private projects.
modal.overview: Built as a personal project to explore scalable data processing and background job handling. The app processes repositories asynchronously to extract commits, resolve contributor profiles via the GitHub API, and generate leaderboards stored in PostgreSQL. It uses a bare clone strategy for efficiency, integrates caching with Redis, and runs fully on Docker for reproducible environments.

items: Fastify server with REST routes for processing and leaderboard generation
Bull and Redis for handling asynchronous jobs and background tasks
Bare repository cloning and incremental fetch strategy to avoid redundant operations
Prisma ORM for database management and migrations with PostgreSQL
In-memory caching and deduplication for contributors
GitHub API integration with caching for efficient user profile lookups
Support for both public and private repositories using authentication tokens
Next.js 15 with React 19 for visualizing leaderboard data
Dynamic status updates for ongoing processing
Clean and responsive UI with error handling and progress indicators
Containerized setup with Docker and Docker Compose
Shared Docker network with PostgreSQL and Redis services
Automatic database migrations using `prisma migrate deploy`
Persistent volumes for caching repositories and database data

technicalHighlights: Implements bare clone and incremental updates to improve performance
Asynchronous architecture for non-blocking processing and scalability
Caching with Redis to minimize repeated API calls
Type-safe data layer with Prisma and PostgreSQL
Designed for local development and easy container orchestration

metrics.performance: Handles repository analysis asynchronously with background jobs
metrics.efficiency: Reduces redundant cloning with incremental Git fetches
metrics.scalability: Supports multiple concurrent jobs through Redis and Bull queues

card.title: GoGitGuru
card.shortDescription: Go-based backend for large-scale GitHub analysis in the blockchain space. Powers the Ethereum Ecosystem Report.

modal.title: GoGitGuru
modal.subtitle: Scalable GitHub Intelligence Platform
modal.purpose: GoGitGuru is the backend foundation behind OpenQ’s ecosystem. It was designed to collect and process large amounts of GitHub data to understand how developers and projects connect within the blockchain space. It builds a clear picture of developer activity, technical expertise, and project dependencies across multiple ecosystems.
modal.overview: The platform is composed of six Go-based microservices — Server API, PublicAPI, RepoSync, UserSync, UserDepSync, and Analytics — each focused on a specific part of the pipeline. The services communicate asynchronously through Kafka, allowing thousands of repositories to be processed concurrently. It parses dependencies in over 13 formats, detects blockchain technologies across more than 150 ecosystems, and stores all processed data in PostgreSQL with read replicas for analytics and reporting.

items: Six independent Go services for modular scaling and maintenance
Internal Server API with 80+ REST endpoints
Public API with token-based authentication for external clients
Asynchronous communication between services using Kafka producer-consumer model
Repository cloning and commit extraction system with retry logic
Dependency parsing covering 13+ formats (npm, pip, go.mod, etc.)
Blockchain detection system identifying 150+ ecosystems and technologies
Data ingestion pipelines feeding PostgreSQL with read replicas for analytics
Kafka-based event distribution with multiple consumer groups and topics
At-least-once delivery semantics with offset tracking and retries
Parallel worker scaling and backpressure control per service
Independent horizontal scaling for each microservice
Aggregated analytics service for contributors, dependencies, and activity insights
Developer graph mapping and skill inference across ecosystems
Advanced reporting using PostgreSQL window functions
Data consumed by OpenQ DRM, Saya, and other web applications built on top of GitGuru’s datasets

technicalHighlights: Developed distributed microservice architecture fully in Go
Adopted Kafka for asynchronous event-driven communication between services
Implemented concurrent RepoSync workers to handle repository ingestion at scale
Created dependency parsing framework supporting 13+ package formats
Added blockchain recognition logic to detect over 150 technologies and networks

metrics.scalability: Six independently deployable services with Kafka consumer scaling
metrics.performance: Processes thousands of repositories in parallel using concurrent workers
metrics.coverage: Supports 150+ blockchain ecosystems and 13+ dependency file formats

card.title: Stackless
card.shortDescription: Enterprise data platform for managing customer data pipelines with AI-powered insights, Snowflake integration, and modular architecture.

modal.title: Stackless
modal.subtitle: Enterprise Data Platform with AI Insights
modal.purpose: Stackless is a data platform built to help organizations manage and analyze customer-specific data ecosystems. It centralizes ingestion, transformation, and visualization through integrated pipelines and AI-driven insights.
modal.overview: The platform combines a FastAPI backend and a React 18 frontend with LangGraph-based AI agents capable of natural language analysis. It supports dynamic dbt model generation, multi-tenant deployments, and real-time WebSocket streaming. Stackless connects seamlessly with Snowflake, Fivetran, and GoodData to cover the full data lifecycle from ingestion to analytics, with secure access control using AWS Cognito.

items: FastAPI backend with modular feature-based structure
Dependency injection container for testable and scalable services
Service-layer abstraction for clean business logic separation
SQLAlchemy ORM and Alembic migrations supporting SQLite and Snowflake
LangGraph agent implementing ReAct reasoning and tool execution
Natural language to SQL translation for analytics
Persistent conversational memory for contextual queries
WebSocket streaming for real-time responses and insights
React 18 frontend built with Mantine UI
Interactive dashboards integrated with GoodData
Dynamic DApp marketplace for modular extensions
Authentication and session management with AWS Cognito
Snowflake integration for analytics and governance
Fivetran ingestion pipelines for external data sources
Dynamic dbt model templates for configurable SQL transformations
RBAC enforcement for multi-tenant and enterprise setups

technicalHighlights: Developed a modular FastAPI backend with dependency injection and service layers
Built a LangGraph-based AI agent capable of reasoning and natural language analysis
Implemented real-time WebSocket streaming for interactive data insights
Generated dbt models dynamically from configuration templates
Integrated Snowflake, Fivetran, and GoodData for complete ETL and analytics workflows

metrics.performance: Concurrent job execution with real-time streaming via WebSockets
metrics.scalability: Multi-tenant architecture with modular backend services
metrics.integration: Connected with major analytics tools for end-to-end data visibility
